intro: Palicourea crocea f. citriflora, commonly known as the citrus-flowered palicourea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that resemble citrus blossoms, giving it its common name. Its leaves are usually ovate with a glossy surface and a pleasant aroma. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and unique floral characteristics.
